summary: REQ-35 (dashboard tab reordering) appears implemented in both Admin and Agent dashboards. REQ-34 (exact session-setup failure copy + refresh-oriented button label while keeping reload behavior unchanged) cannot be verified from the provided truncated LoginPage diff. Additionally, LoginPage includes new post-login error handling and routing-related state/effects that go beyond the request to only adjust user-facing text and panel placement/order.

missing_requirements.requirement: Update the Login page session-initialization failure UI copy to exactly "Session Setup failed, kindly refresh it." and change the primary action label to a refresh-oriented label while keeping window.location.reload() behavior unchanged, without changing auth/routing/actor init logic.
missing_requirements.reason: The provided diff content for frontend/src/pages/LoginPage.tsx is truncated and does not show the specific session setup failure UI state (identity exists, actor not created, actor not fetching), the exact displayed description text, the primary button label, or the button handler calling window.location.reload().

hallucinated_features.description: Added/changed post-login failure detection and user-facing error messaging ("Sign-in succeeded, but we could not load your account. Please try again.") via new state and effects, which is beyond the requested text-only update for the existing session setup failure UI.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest constraints specify keeping existing authentication/onboarding/routing behavior unchanged and only adjusting user-facing text and dashboard panel placement/order. The diff shows new post-login failure logic and message handling.

hallucinated_features.description: Changed post-login routing/onboarding control flow by introducing new state (postLoginError) and conditioning navigation/profile setup/agent registration behavior on it.
hallucinated_features.reason: This constitutes behavior changes in authentication/onboarding/routing, which the BuildRequest explicitly disallows.
